item.title: Builders blocking residents’ bays, 22nd July
item.description:
Hi. Builders working at 18 King Edwards Road put out cones on Warneford Street on Sunday blocking three residents’ bays. Still there today and no sign of moving. They have not applied for a licence to suspend. Unfair to residents. Can council take action?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): King Edwards Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Bed Mattress and Excessive Litter, 22nd July
item.description:
The stretch of road from the south exit of the Blackwall Tunnel is full of very old accumulated litter particularly on the ascent up over the bridge. There is a bed mattress which has been abandoned there for years and general litter. It aggrieves me that we now pay to use the Blackwall Tunnel and the entrance in both North and South routes is a mess with litter. It is out of control now as it has not been dealt with for a very long time. It is an embarrassment that it has got to this and I have concerns that it will start to spill onto the carriage way and hinder driving. Please take action as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackwall Tunnel Approach, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
